From ancient times to now, the medicine remains the same.
The medicine is not far—it lies within people,
Yet fools wander in all directions.
Speak no more—quietly, silently,
Lest others know and mock.
Once formed into grains, observe the sun’s shadow,
From ignorance to sagehood, without birth or chaos.
Place it in the gourd—do not pour carelessly,
Follow the seasons and nodes to restore celestial truth.
One primordial breath, sixteen ounces,
Nurtured by three hundred sixty-four hexagrams.
When the earth-thunder hexagram revives, respond to the yang line,
In moments of slack, take the medicine and cast it into your mouth.
Send it with true water, swallow nine times,
Beware—let no vulgar person see.
Pass the towering mansion, reach the five viscera,
Dispersing into the meridians, guarding heaven and man.
Cure existing illnesses, prevent future ones—
Who would seize the true to mend their own life?
From the first line to the six positions,
This medicine embodies the sun and moon’s principle.
It can reverse aging, restore youth,
Life submits to the medicine’s power, not to heaven.
When the medicine descends, seal the mysterious pass,
Lest the medicine’s power leak outward.
As the medicine’s power turns, the spirit’s radiance clears,
The mysterious pearl follows, transforming into a shooting star.
Sun and moon shine within, the belly hums,
Illuminating all worldly affairs as unjust.
Follow the monthly method—six nodes,
Each node must be met without omission.
When the foundation stirs, if the base moves, the medicine is useless.
When taking this medicine, observe taboos:
Dispel vexations, dispel troubles, dispel entanglements.
Secure the chamber, guard the empty room,
A year’s time—your body will be like steel.
Black turns white, white turns red,
Will resides in the heart, refinement in effort.
The Joyous Pill, white as snow,
Easy to find in taste, hard to seek in its secret.
Were it not for me to establish these guidelines,
The medicine’s essence would scatter through the eight vessels.
The medicine flows through the hundred meridians,
Three years transform the inner sun and moon.
The Joyous Pill, no leaking pearl,
From here, ascend to heaven on high.
Nurtured by the hexagrams, the Great Returned Elixir is complete—
Father and son, ruler and minister—do not reveal it.

**Song of the Golden Essence**
To obtain the golden essence, one must follow the work’s progression.
The golden crucible rests on earth,
Seek again the original body.
Fire flies, water surges—
Discern floating and sinking.
When the crucible’s mouth boils over,
Gather and swallow it again.
Now the true secret is revealed—
This is the genuine essence.
Do not harbor attachments,
Lest they harm your body.
Parents are the root, lead and mercury the foundation.
This is no filth—it returns to transform into an immortal.
Like a child serving a father, like a minister serving a ruler,
Depend on heaven, depend on earth—only then can man beget man.
How can an empty yin spirit give birth to man?
Only when parents give life to the body does this spirit arise.
When this body decays, the spirit returns to emptiness.
If you obtain the golden essence,
Preserve life and plant its root.
After a thousand mornings of work, you endure for eternal eons.

**Poem**
Profound, profound—
Before earth, before heaven,
In the indistinct, it endlessly extends.
The ancestor of the Great Dao,
The source of yin and yang.
Ancient immortals transmitted this method,
Worthy scholars fathomed its depths.
If learners grasp this principle,
They preserve their form and dwell in the world for long years.
Only when the golden elixir completes nine revolutions
Do they know how to change their bones and become immortals.

Elixir, elixir—
Hard to comprehend, hard to speak,
The dragon’s marrow, the tiger’s liver,
Yin and yang’s creation,
The sun and moon’s two inquiries.
To gather the mid-autumn moon,
Warm it after winter’s cold.
If ingested, one returns to the purple palace,
Advancing the fire relies entirely on the mechanism.
If later learners can follow this secret,
Their work completed, they will surely ride a soaring simurgh.

Medicine, medicine—
Diligently use, diligently refine,
Growing jade towers, birthing phoenix pavilions,
Above piercing the jade hare,
Below connecting the sun’s rays.
Gathered and placed in the crucible to refine,
Harmonized—do not let it err.
Forging, drawing, adding,
Bathing in the process—
All depend on the encompassing frame.
When the work’s merit fills three thousand,
The immortal lad summons me to the azure vault.

Lead, lead—
The true source of the watery realm,
Born of geng and xin, belonging to qian,
Always dwelling in the kan position,
Hidden in the north.
When it meets the mercury of the li palace,
Refine it into a ball of jade.
Eternally guard the divine furnace, tightly sealed,
Making one’s nature and life firm and enduring.
Only when the Jade Emperor’s decree arrives
Will you steadily ride a simurgh and phoenix to the blue heavens.

Mercury, mercury—
Fools tamper with it,
Hidden in cinnabar, concealed in stone crevices,
Following the flow, it becomes human;
Reversed, it serves as the elixir’s use.
Refined with fire, it becomes an elixir;
Without fire, labor is in vain.
Harmonized with lead in one place,
Further sent by the Yellow Dame.

Nine returns, seven reversions—enter the Central Palace,
The host of immortals commands me to mount simurgh and phoenix.

Furnace, furnace—
Born of emptiness and nothingness,
Fit for refining and nurturing,
Holding the Mysterious Pearl,
Above linked to celestial patterns, spread within the Eight Trigrams,
Below joined to earthly principles, encircled by the Four Images.
Circulate fire through the celestial cycles,
In cultivating the elixir, never err or stray.
Only when the Central Palace’s qi is full
Will the lotus bloom to distinguish the wise from the foolish.

Sword, sword—
Utterly numinous, utterly efficacious,
Soaring through the great void, racing with thunder and lightning,
Severing the Three Peaks, cleaving the sea’s surface,
Dispelling all yin demons,
Making demonic spirits tremble in fear.
At midnight, seize the luminous pearl,
Divine radiance appears and vanishes in turn.
In time, it preserves my life and grants longevity,
Bearing the blade straight to the Three Pure Ones’ palace.

Fire, fire—
The work is of utmost magnitude,
Awaiting the proper moment, never let it slip by,
The mechanism for the steadfast, the calamity for the foolish.
Refining the medicine relies on the xun wind,
Host and guest take their respective seats.
Morning and evening, the lines connect yin and yang,
Advancing and retreating, withdrawing and adding—all rest with me.
Only when the work is brought to completion
Will man and woman leap free from the fetters of worldly toil.

Crucible, crucible—
Hard to encounter yet easy to fathom,
Established by the Mysterious Origin, named by the Yellow Emperor,
Forged through yin and yang, concealed among the common and the sage.
Vast and distant, its source is hard to trace,
Like gazing at the sun’s reflection in water.
Its position corresponds to geng, xin, and the kun earth,
Treasure hidden at the Three Peaks’ summit.
Wielding the sword, cleave open the Three Clans’ gate,
Behold the body leap forth into the true immortal realm.
Black metal transforms into white metal,
White metal transforms into yellow metal,
Yellow metal becomes the supreme medicine—
Thus is perfection attained.
Within the mysterious lies the further mysterious—this is my life,
Within life lies yet another life—this is my form.

Recorded by Tang Jian, the Perfected of Attained Numinosity
In the year I first knew my fate, I followed the imperial carriage on its western journey. During the Tianbao era, in the dinghai year of the eleventh month, I encountered the Elder of Qingcheng, who bestowed upon me the true elixir formula of Primordial Origin. Its meaning was beyond my full comprehension. As the imperial progress halted, my duties in the Bureau of Appointments grew burdensome. By the Zhide era of Emperor Suzong, in the dingyou year, I was granted leave to reside on Mount Song. There, I again met the Elder, who at last revealed the essentials of Divine Water and Yellow Sprout. Upon completion, I sought permission to return and pay homage at the imperial court, then petitioned to retire and return to my fields.

At that time, Zhang Qufei, Director of the Southern Bureau, and Cheng Taixu, Left Historian, both having left their official posts, jointly constructed a sacred chamber with me. We refined cinnabar in the crucible, and after a full cycle of days, the elixir’s radiance suffused my flesh. My complexion and hair grew vibrant, and I ascended the void without fear. My intent grew ever more attuned to the numinous, and the medicine’s efficacy became profound—yet others remained unaware of its power.

Some say that to prolong life, one must return essence to supplement qi, regulate breath and expand the mechanism, so that in the exchange of entry and exit, the turbid is expelled and the pure retained—this is truly the internal issuing forth and external entering in. But where does essence return from, and where does it enter? Some regard exhalation and inhalation as the essence’s brilliance, yet how can this avoid the decline of the waist’s vitality? Some consider entry and exit as true qi, yet how can this avoid the labor that harms the skin?

For those in the prime of life, this is indeed the root of genuine depletion. Once the essence’s brilliance is lost, the spirit and soul scatter in four directions—how then can it be returned? Those who preserve their primal qi from youth and constantly practice movement may prolong their years, but this is merely a lower grade, lacking the effect of ascending the void. Only by externally refining the fire dragon and internally circulating the golden essence can one directly attain the rank of high perfection—this is the way of the supreme immortal.

Since I first ingested the numinous elixir in the Zhide dingyou year, up to the present Qianfu jiawu year of the current emperor, I have traversed one hundred and twelve years across twelve reigns. Though my official duties and meritorious deeds were diligent, only upon regaining my youth and recovering my original state did my intent fully commune with the numinous. Compared to Zhang and Cheng, I lagged by twelve years.

Now, as the Son of Heaven wanders in exile and treacherous ministers usurp power, I journey westward and once more encounter Master Zhongli, with whom I travel and lodge. Together, we transcend the Three Vehicles, yet deluded followers cling to the past and refuse to turn back—how truly lamentable! My purpose in writing is to awaken those lost on the demonic paths below and open the true realm of the celestial immortals above.

Recorded on a bingzi day in the yiwei year of the Qianfu era.

Lü Men, the Perfected, Paints His True Likeness and Composes This Self-Eulogy
The Dao encompasses heaven and earth, unbounded by limits.
Shaking the eight directions, who can depict its form?
In a fleeting moment, the finest stroke is laid down,
Illuminating the mortal world for a thousand ages in cinnabar and ink.
Striding across the sea toward Penglai, it soars into the space between the brows.
A raven etched in autumn’s hues transforms into radiant spirit.
Suddenly, evening mist reveals the moon over plum blossoms,
While a spring breeze swiftly traverses the six yang phases.
In semblance, only a fraction can be captured;
In transformation, its depths remain unfathomable.
Brightly, one awakens to where things move the heart—
Who on this sea of dust can tread the jade-strewn path?

Thus concludes the *Secret Formula for the Returned Elixir, Volume the Lower*.

chunks.original_text: 还丹肘后诀 经名：还丹肘复诀。 撰人不详，约出矜唐宋问。 三卷。 上卷官外丹方诀，内容多与《通山诀》相同。 中下二卷慕集诸家丹经歌诀，兼论内外丹法。 底本出处：《正统道藏》洞神部众街类。 还丹肘后诀卷上 肘后诀者，稚川葛真人所撰。 十卷。 其九则论天下方书、草药救治之门，其一则辨金石大丹、黄芽之真，至於火候，皆晓然而书之，以垂范於将来学者，使无错误。 得此诀者，大药门中，分别其半矣。 余有口诀，苦不烦心。 是知至真用意，汲引昏迷，俾皆得成於仙矣。 后之学士，切宜详之。 诀曰：宝丹本乎一物，而生二。 二生火，寄位丙丁，生於甲乙。 初九，潜龙一阳生，建子天符，发泄惊垫，受黑於母，母者土也。 道生一，一生二，二生三。 三者阳之父母，阳者天地之精。 故名三五与一，还丹之本基也。 天符曰信，日者天地之元精，五行之始照耀。 以年计月，以月计日，以日计时，以时纪年，所以纪远近，则同异也。 混沌初分，精黑阴阳，斗建十二辰，推移运转，刻漏不停，发泄交娠，万物化生而成形。 天符者，信也。 能发泄，万物化生而成形，运动反本而成精，阳黑潜运，结化为精。 精化为砂，色禀南方丙丁火，外阳而内阴，主男、日，主阳魂，日月之华黑，昭一耀天地。 太阳太阴黑合中和，交接受黑一千八十年，结精为砂。 又天符照耀一千八十年，成形名朱砂。 汞於朱砂中生也，阳中阴，号日太阳朱雀，主水。 元和黑未足曰丹砂，又云天铅、男龙、女血。 化南作北，抽出朱，化为阴汞，主水，数一，故云汞阳为臣也。 天铅神水，天符运动，昭一耀丹砂，养育又一千八十年，天火造化，阳黑受足，而阴黑衰，阳熙盛满，流溢迥然，而自生色，禀北方壬癸水，而外阴内阳，主月之阴魄，非人问凡物，故赤石中自有生者，流为阳汞，名日天铅之精，黄芽之祖，是日月之精华，化为天然还丹，自然伏火黑色，化北成西，主金，数四，水基也。 故云三五与一，天地至精。 三者，火之父母。 五者，砂之父母。 一者，砂之元祖。 回还运转，精黑元和而相感成形，不越于一。 一者，大道之本宗，水也。 学者不知朱砂是铅，铅中生子是金也。 一物阴阳，自运转，自制伏。 阳中阴，阴中阳，玄中玄，名日玄武石。 化水成金，故日砂。 产於金阴中，为君名铅金。 天符运动，计四千三百二十年，照耀父母，养成天铅，自然还丹也。 诀日：后世圣人用火喻爻象，一月计三百六十时，一年气候计四千三百二十时，合自然还丹，名日朱砂汞，金中水。 水北火南，龙束虎西，五行合体，归一无二得五。 以地符依对节候运动，以成金丹。 诀曰：其丹砂出自中华，十二分野内二宫，西南坤地。 其宝乃天地之至精，元和之正黑，以日月天符，运动交娠在五。 五者，戊己，中宫土也。 所生之处、生於福德山冈，形势之地，气血骨肉俱金，水木咸秀，骨肉俱全者。 乃草木俱茂，土石坚贞、则异境神灵卫护，阴阳之黑施泄，包含孕育，照耀精黑，得土而生，化为丹砂。 凡有砂处，昼夜初晴之后，或阴暗之时，则有光彩，如日之出，或隐或现，惟采匠识之。 其所出之处名丹砂，亦名朱砂。 丹砂，朱铅，天铅，火铅，铅中金，神水华池，阴汞，阳汞，水银，阳中阴，阴中阳，五彩石，五金，七宝主，还丹，天生黄芽，五行之始。

**The Elbow-Pocket Formula for Cyclically Transmuted Cinnabar**

**Title of the Scripture:** *The Elbow-Pocket Formula for Cyclic Reversion of Cinnabar*
**Author:** Unknown; roughly dated between the Tang and Song dynasties.
**Volume:** Three.
The first volume records formulas and methods for external alchemy, much of which aligns with *The Cavern Mountain Formula*. The middle and lower volumes compile verses and formulas from various alchemical scriptures, discussing both internal and external alchemical methods.
**Source of the Base Text:** *Daoist Canon of the Zhengtong Era*, *Section of the Cavernous Divine*, *Category of Miscellaneous Arts*.

---

### *The Elbow-Pocket Formula for Cyclically Transmuted Cinnabar, Volume One*

The *Elbow-Pocket Formula* was composed by the Perfected Master Ge of Zhichuan. Originally in ten volumes—nine of which expound upon the world’s medical texts and herbal remedies for healing—the tenth distinguishes the authenticity of metallic minerals, great elixirs, and the Yellow Sprout, clarifying the firing times with crystalline precision. It was written to serve as a model for future scholars, preventing errors. Whoever obtains this formula has already grasped half of the great elixir’s gate.

I possess oral instructions, yet they are not burdensome to the mind. Thus, the utmost truth is conveyed with intent, guiding the benighted so that all may attain immortality. Later scholars must study this carefully.

**The Formula states:**
The treasure elixir originates from the One, which generates the Two. The Two generates Fire, lodged in *bing*-*ding*, born of *jia*-*yi*. At the *ninth-initial*, the Hidden Dragon stirs as the solitary Yang arises. The *jianzi* celestial tally aligns, releasing and concealing in shock and trepidation, receiving the Black from the Mother—Mother being Earth.

The Dao generates the One, the One generates the Two, the Two generates the Three. The Three are the parents of Yang; Yang is the essence of Heaven and Earth. Thus, the Three, Five, and One form the foundation of cyclically transmuted cinnabar.

The celestial tally is called *Trust*. The Sun is the primordial essence of Heaven and Earth, the first illumination of the Five Phases. Years are reckoned by months, months by days, days by hours, and hours by years—thus measuring distance and discerning sameness and difference.

When primordial chaos first divided, the essence and Black of Yin and Yang emerged. The Dipper’s handle marks the twelve branches, shifting and revolving without cease. The clepsydra’s drip never halts; release and intermingling give birth to the myriad things, shaping their forms.

The celestial tally is *Trust*—capable of release, enabling the myriad things to take form. Movement returns to the root, condensing into essence. The Yin Black stealthily circulates, congealing and transforming into essence. Essence transforms into cinnabar, its color endowed by the southern *bing*-*ding* Fire—externally Yang, internally Yin—ruling man, the Sun, and the Yang soul. The radiance of the Sun and Moon’s essence and Black shines as one, illuminating Heaven and Earth.

The Great Yang and Great Yin Blacks harmonize in the center, exchanging and receiving for 1,080 years, condensing essence into cinnabar. Another 1,080 years under the celestial tally’s illumination completes its form, named *Cinnabar*. Mercury is born within cinnabar—Yang within Yin—called the *Great Yang Vermilion Bird*, ruling Water.

When the primordial harmony’s Black is insufficient, it is called *Cinnabar Sand*, also known as *Celestial Lead*, *Male Dragon*, or *Female Blood*. Transforming south into north, extracting the vermilion, it becomes Yin Mercury, ruling Water, numbered One—thus Mercury is said to be the Yang minister.

*Celestial Lead* is divine water. The celestial tally’s movement illuminates cinnabar, nurturing it for another 1,080 years. Heavenly Fire’s transformation fills the Yang Black, while the Yin Black wanes. Yang flourishes to fullness, overflowing in brilliance, naturally generating color—endowed by the northern *ren*-*gui* Water, externally Yin and internally Yang—ruling the Moon’s Yin spirit. It is no common worldly substance, for within red stone, it spontaneously generates, flowing as Yang Mercury. Named the *Essence of Celestial Lead*, the *Ancestor of the Yellow Sprout*, it is the essence and radiance of the Sun and Moon, transformed into natural cyclically transmuted cinnabar. Naturally subduing Fire, its Black color shifts from north to west, ruling Metal, numbered Four—the foundation of Water.

Thus, the Three, Five, and One are the utmost essence of Heaven and Earth. The Three are the parents of Fire; the Five, the parents of cinnabar; the One, the primordial ancestor of cinnabar. Revolving and circulating, essence and primordial harmony interact to form shape, never straying from the One. The One is the root and origin of the Great Dao—Water.

Scholars fail to recognize that cinnabar is Lead, and the child born within Lead is Gold. A single entity of Yin and Yang self-circulates, self-regulates. Yang within Yin, Yin within Yang, Mystery within Mystery—called the *Mysterious Warrior Stone*. Transforming Water into Gold, it is thus named *Cinnabar*. Born within the Yin of Metal, it is the sovereign, named *Lead-Gold*.

The celestial tally’s movement, over 4,320 years, illuminates its parents, nurturing *Celestial Lead* into natural cyclically transmuted cinnabar.

**The Formula states:**
Later sages used Fire to illustrate the hexagrams. A month comprises 360 hours; a year’s climatic phases total 4,320 hours—matching the natural cyclically transmuted cinnabar, named *Cinnabar Mercury*, the Water within Gold. Water to the north, Fire to the south; Dragon to the east, Tiger to the west. The Five Phases unite in one body, returning to the undivided Five. By aligning with the earthly tally and adhering to the seasonal nodes’ movement, the Golden Elixir is achieved.

**The Formula states:**
This cinnabar emerges within the Central Hua, in the twelfth terrestrial division’s second palace—the southwest *kun* region. This treasure is the utmost essence of Heaven and Earth, the correct Black of primordial harmony. Through the Sun, Moon, and celestial tally’s movement, intermingling occurs in the Five. The Five are *wu*-*ji*, the central palace’s Earth.

The places where it is born—auspicious mountains and ridges, lands of favorable terrain—possess the Qi, Blood, Bones, and Flesh of Metal, with Water and Wood both flourishing. Where bones and flesh are complete, grasses and trees thrive, soil and stone are firm and steadfast—such extraordinary realms are guarded by divine spirits. The Yin and Yang Blacks release and nurture, containing and gestating, illuminating essence and Black. Born of Earth, it transforms into cinnabar.

Wherever cinnabar is found, after the first clear dawn or in dim light, radiance appears like the rising Sun—now hidden, now visible—discernible only to skilled miners. The places where it emerges are called *Cinnabar*, also named *Vermilion Sand*.

chunks.original_text: 其地名桂府、辰锦、衡丘、句漏、云梦、都山、梆永、全道，潭岳等管处，岩石穴洞，形势滋茂之处，即有新旧坑穴，皆有不定丹砂，光明镜面，如莲花芙蓉，鲜红透彻，并为上品。 其次中下，不及枚举，亦可取汞制伏别甩，不作上丹大药也。 上品丹砂，如人主登位，百僚奉上。 中者如名臣，下者如庶、人。 但可指使，无自专之才。 天符者，日也。 阳之精魂，天之理也，照耀光明。 《 淮南》 曰：聚阳之黑为火，火之精为日，光咀纯晶，日之义也。 又云：日生於甲，重阳之位。 火生於震，震为长男，巽为长女，火之父母。 火曰曾，木日青，万物之使，故云曾青。 言月者阴之精魄，地之理也，耀光明。 《 淮南》 曰：聚阴之寒黑，腾为水，水之精为月，满之而缺，月之义也。 又云：月生於庚，重阴之位。 水生於兑，兑为少女，坎为中男，水之父母。 所以男依日出束，女象月升西。 故经云：丹砂者，日月之精华，性命之根基，与内外元和，般载成形，饵之长生不死，日月之感精。 故曰：月之所生，日之所育也。 生成依於母，母者土也。 是日月二宝，天地至精。 甲庚感精变化，昭一耀成形，结而为砂，始名朱雀，乃七十二石中最尊，莫过於汞。 感於二十四黑，通於二十四名，鸡餐成凤，蛇吞化龙，人食长生，天地寿同，敛魂聚魄，返老为童，呼吸风云，玉女来从，此大还丹之力也。 诀曰：红铅者，丹砂也。 砂中抽出之液，主水，阳中阴汞也。 从砂中自出者，主阴，金中阳汞也。 是以不容之木，受制於金，金孕水，安水必存。 金木孕火，制火必假水，所以铅水制汞水，铅火制汞火。 木含其性，火合其形也。 诀曰：铅水者，是砂中自生出者，为阳汞也。 汞水也，砂中抽出之液，乃阴汞是也。 故云：铅水制汞水。 又云：铅火者，自生之金。 汞火者，抽出之掖也。 且铅火制汞火，世人多不晓此义，故曰铅汞道也。 日者，太阳之火精，则汞木为龙是也。 月者，太阴之水精，则铅金为虎是也。 龙者，阳黑，九之极数，木之精黑也。 虎者，阴黑，四之极数，金之精黑也。 诀曰：以无制有，合成其道。 故云：丹砂木精，得金乃并，分铢不偏，至圣至灵。 世之不悟，见金如土也。 药日太玄。 阴符之道生阴阳，阴阳生五行，合之为还丹，故名龙虎。 天有三，日月星。 地有三，江河海。 人有三，精黑神。 药有三，水土金。 故乾坤，上下釜也。 坎离者，水火为药也。 震巽者，进退也。 运经三年，象自然还丹，即天元之黑足，岂不成丹者哉。 诀曰：计三年一万二千九百六十时，大小月并闰月也、并不在用限，归其实数也。 一黑不足，与瓦砾无殊。 万象通灵，神明自契。

The regions known as *Guifu*, *Chenjin*, *Hengqiu*, *Joulou*, *Yunmeng*, *Dushan*, *Bangyong*, *Quandao*, *Tanyue*, and their governed lands—where cliffs, rocky caverns, and lush terrain abound—host both new and ancient mines. Within these, cinnabar of varying grades appears, its luminous surface smooth as a mirror, resembling lotus blossoms or hibiscus, vibrant red and translucent, all deemed top-tier. The middle and lower grades, too numerous to list, may still yield mercury for refinement and other uses, though they are unfit for the supreme elixir of great alchemy.

Top-grade cinnabar is like a sovereign ascending the throne, with all officials in attendance. The middle grade resembles a renowned minister, while the lower grade is akin to common folk—serviceable, yet lacking independent mastery.

The celestial tally is the Sun, the essence and spirit of Yang, the principle of Heaven, radiating brilliance. *Huainanzi* states: "The gathering of Yang’s *qi* forms fire; the essence of fire is the Sun, whose pure, crystalline light embodies its meaning." It further says: "The Sun is born of *jia*, the position of double Yang. Fire arises from *zhen*, *zhen* being the eldest son, *xun* the eldest daughter—the parents of fire." Fire is called *zeng*, wood *qing*; all things are governed by them, hence the term *zengqing*.

The Moon is the essence and soul of Yin, the principle of Earth, casting its glow. *Huainanzi* says: "The gathering of Yin’s cold *qi* ascends as water; the essence of water is the Moon, waxing and waning to fulfill its nature." It further states: "The Moon is born of *geng*, the position of double Yin. Water arises from *dui*, *dui* being the youngest daughter, *kan* the middle son—the parents of water." Thus, man aligns with the Sun’s rise in the east, while woman mirrors the Moon’s ascent in the west.

The scriptures declare: "Cinnabar is the essence of the Sun and Moon, the root of life and destiny, harmonizing inner and outer primal *qi*. It bears and shapes form, and when ingested, grants immortality—the mutual resonance of Sun and Moon." Hence it is said: "The Moon’s birth and the Sun’s nurturance depend on the mother, who is Earth." These two treasures, Sun and Moon, are the purest essences of Heaven and Earth. The union of *jia* and *geng* transforms and refines, their radiance coalescing into form, crystallizing as cinnabar—first named *Vermilion Phoenix*, the most revered among the seventy-two stones, none surpassing mercury.

Resonating with the twenty-four *qi*, manifesting in twenty-four names, a chicken fed upon it becomes a phoenix, a serpent that swallows it transforms into a dragon, and one who consumes it attains longevity, their lifespan equaling Heaven and Earth. It gathers the hun and po, reverses aging to youth, commands the winds and clouds, and summons jade maidens—such is the power of the great cyclically transmuted cinnabar.

The formula states: "Red lead is cinnabar. The liquid drawn from cinnabar governs water—*yang*-within-*yin* mercury. That which emerges naturally from cinnabar governs *yin*—*yang*-within-metal mercury." Thus, the wood that cannot be contained is restrained by metal; metal nurtures water, and water’s stability depends on its presence. Metal and wood nurture fire, and fire’s control relies on water. Therefore, lead-water restrains mercury-water, and lead-fire restrains mercury-fire. Wood embodies its nature, while fire unites its form.

The formula states: "Lead-water is the mercury that naturally arises from cinnabar—*yang* mercury. Mercury-water is the liquid extracted from cinnabar—*yin* mercury." Hence it is said: "Lead-water restrains mercury-water." It further says: "Lead-fire is the metal that arises naturally. Mercury-fire is the liquid drawn out." Yet lead-fire restraining mercury-fire is a principle many fail to grasp, thus it is called the Dao of lead and mercury.

The Sun is the fiery essence of Great Yang—mercury-wood as the dragon. The Moon is the watery essence of Great Yin—lead-metal as the tiger. The dragon is Yang *qi*, the utmost of the number nine, the essence of wood. The tiger is Yin *qi*, the utmost of the number four, the essence of metal.

The formula states: "Use non-being to restrain being, and the Dao is complete." Thus it is said: "Cinnabar, the essence of wood, unites with metal without the slightest deviation—most sacred, most numinous." Yet the world, failing to comprehend, sees gold as mere earth.

The elixir is called *Tai Xuan*. The Dao of the *Yin Fu* generates Yin and Yang; Yin and Yang generate the Five Phases, their union forming cyclically transmuted cinnabar—hence the name *Dragon and Tiger*.

Heaven has three: Sun, Moon, and stars. Earth has three: rivers, lakes, and seas. Man has three: essence, *qi*, and spirit. The elixir has three: water, earth, and metal. Thus, *Qian* and *Kun* are the upper and lower crucibles. *Kan* and *Li* are water and fire as the elixir. *Zhen* and *Xun* govern advance and retreat. Circulating for three years mirrors the natural cyclically transmuted cinnabar—once the *qi* of Heaven’s origin is sufficient, how could the elixir fail to form?

The formula states: "Calculate three years as twelve thousand nine hundred and sixty hours, accounting for long and short months and intercalary months—though not within the prescribed limit, this is the true count." If even one *qi* is lacking, it differs not from worthless rubble. When the myriad phenomena attain numinosity, the divine and enlightened naturally align.

chunks.original_text: 号云金砂，名曰大还。 还者，返本之义也。 诀曰：阴符运转，黑化为精，精化为朱，朱化为汞，汞化为金，金化为药。 丹者，赤色之义。 汞者，本体金水相制，故号金砂。 还归本体，故号大还丹也。 一云：五黑金鼎也。 诀曰：五黑制伏不飞，能生五彩，返归其母，服之长生。 丹砂流汞父，戊己黄金母，母数五，五者是用土为鼎，制伏不飞，号曰金鼎。 土能生万物，金是土生，故云金父。 金父者，本土。 故日土父，日母水。 以土为鬼，土镇水不起，戊己之功也，名日五符。 汞者非土不可制伏，土旺金乡，三物俱之象帝。 如人主之有道，则四方来贡。 但辨得真，铅汞二物，是一鼎法。 故三物一家，都归戊己。 金水无土制御不成丹。 土每一季王十八日，余日休囚。 伏炼金鼎，惟究阴阳，精黑返还，刻漏不停。 雄阳喻土而定四维。 土者，是生金之土，雄者是男，黄者是土。 土能制水，土是金父，非干雄黄也。 鼎主外土，名五符也。 世人不悟还丹本父母，错用金银为父母，或为鼎。 故黑不足者，不离於五，五不离於六黑。 混其名即一，辨其功即殊。 元黑五材之君，五材之黑，君臣相临，而不可去也。 金丹用元黑，不曰五符。 五符者黑，黑者无形，因精而生，内外含真，得服者不死长生。 金鼎者，药之表辖。 表者黑，黑者鼎也。 鼎象鸡子，外白而内黄也。 与汞合，是用白金为器。 器者不离於五，五者土，土者生金之土，委曲相制，以使无虞，令水不飞，戊己之功也。 诀曰：提剑偃戈，笼罩四方。 提剑是金精，本黑五也。 偃戈戟，其如水得而不飞，是死於土也。 大丹之基，丹砂是铅，本生於土，死亦依於土也。 是丹砂本土，达於至道者知之。 诀曰：鼎之异名，外神水华池，神室匡廓，表辖五黑，白衣丹衣，母金母舍，五宫，金鼎神炉。 诀曰：元黑者，其大笼罩八隅，小则潜藏一毫。 吐坤呕轮，出有入无，流珠九转，父不语子，化为黄白，自然相使，一阴一阳曰道，钦伏於金鼎也。 金丹者，天地日月元和之熙，照耀潜运，而成丹砂。 砂中乃迥然而生自然还丹也。 如人孕育男女，皆由父母阴阳精气，相感而有。 还丹者，象男生而覆，女生而仰，非但生也，死亦如之。 但投於水，雄者覆而雌者仰，天使其性，非父母使然。 金水在鼎中，象男女相感，男上而女下，自得其情，两精相搏，以成大道。 诀曰：金丹须得元基，须得本父母养育制伏。 父者，阳黑也。 父能发泄，运动而成之。 母者，土，阴黑也。 母能含育而生之。 母主中宫。 黄土者，是本生金之土也。 丹砂初受黑，依土而生成，故云黄芽之本母也。 得阳而成，得母而生，故云土父。 土父日水母。 五者，五行之母，生生而土也。 水火金木土，各居一方，而运动正位。 火克金，土克水，水乃丹砂之子。 土者鼎也。 火者，运动而成形，得土而生成。 土能制水，本黑相感，而成道。 故云：知白守黑。 世人尽不知同类相从相生，相制相克。 水以土为鬼，土镇水不起，戊己之功，名曰五符金鼎，知之者万中一焉。 地符，火木之精，火能炊熟万物，以育人命。 火者，甲之精，阳之元黑，结妮交会，而同日月之精，归一无二。 甲之精火，火数二，二生三，成数九，九者阳之极数，火黑也。

Designated as "Golden Sand," it is called the Great Return. "Return" signifies the meaning of reverting to the root.

The formula states: The *yin* tally revolves, *qi* transforms into essence, essence into cinnabar, cinnabar into mercury, mercury into gold, and gold into the elixir. "Elixir" denotes the meaning of red hue. Mercury, by nature, is metal and water restraining each other, hence the name "Golden Sand." Returning to the original substance, it is thus called the Great Return Elixir.

Another tradition says: the Five-*Qi* Metal Crucible. The formula states: the Five *Qi* subdue and prevent volatilization, generating the Five Colors, reverting to their mother—consuming it grants longevity. Cinnabar flows mercury as father, *wu-ji* yellow gold as mother. The mother’s number is five; five employs earth as the crucible, subduing and preventing volatilization, hence called the Metal Crucible. Earth engenders the myriad things; metal is born of earth, thus called the Metal Father. The Metal Father is fundamentally earth. Thus, earth is the father, water the mother. Earth acts as the ghost: earth suppresses water from rising—this is the achievement of *wu-ji*, named the Five Tallies. Without earth, mercury cannot be subdued. Earth flourishes in the metal phase; the three substances together resemble the Emperor. As a ruler with the Dao, the four directions come to pay tribute. Simply discern the true lead and mercury—these two substances form a single crucible method. Thus, the three substances are one household, all converging in *wu-ji*. Without earth to restrain metal and water, the elixir cannot form. Earth reigns for eighteen days each season; on remaining days, it rests or wanes. Refining the Metal Crucible requires thorough investigation of *yin-yang*; essence and *qi* return ceaselessly, like the unceasing drip of a water clock. The potent yang, likened to earth, stabilizes the four directions. Earth is the earth that generates metal; "potent" refers to the male, "yellow" to earth. Earth can restrain water; earth is the Metal Father—not the *qian* of realgar. The crucible governs external earth, named the Five Tallies.

The world does not comprehend that the Return Elixir’s root lies in father and mother, mistakenly using gold and silver as parents or crucibles. If *qi* is insufficient, it does not depart from the Five; the Five does not depart from the Six *Qi*. Though their names are conflated as one, their functions differ upon distinction. Original *qi* is the lord of the Five Materials; the *qi* of the Five Materials, with ruler and minister in attendance, cannot be abandoned. The Golden Elixir employs original *qi*, not the Five Tallies. The Five Tallies are *qi*; *qi* is formless, arising from essence, containing truth within and without—consuming it grants deathlessness and longevity.

The Metal Crucible is the outer lock of the elixir. The "outer" is *qi*; *qi* is the crucible. The crucible resembles a chicken’s egg: white outside, yellow within. Combined with mercury, white metal is used as the vessel. The vessel does not depart from the Five; Five is earth, the earth that generates metal. Through intricate mutual restraint, it ensures no mishap, preventing water from volatilizing—this is the achievement of *wu-ji*.

The formula states: "Raise the sword, lay down the halberd, enshrouding the four directions." Raising the sword is the essence of metal, fundamentally the Five *Qi*. Laying down the halberd and spear ensures water, once obtained, does not fly—it dies in earth. The foundation of the Great Elixir is cinnabar as lead, born of earth and dying also in earth. That cinnabar’s root is earth—only those who attain the utmost Dao know this.

The formula states: Alternative names for the crucible include: External Spirit Water Flower Pond, Spirit Chamber Enclosure, Outer Lock Five *Qi*, White Robe Elixir Robe, Mother Metal Mother Abode, Five Palaces, Metal Crucible Spirit Furnace.

The formula states: Original *qi* broadly enshrouds the eight directions; in minute form, it lurks within a single hair. It exhales *Kun* and vomits the wheel, emerging from existence and entering non-existence. Flowing pearls undergo nine revolutions; the father does not speak to the son. Transformed into yellow and white, they naturally interact. One *yin*, one *yang*—this is the Dao, reverently subdued within the Metal Crucible.

The Golden Elixir is the harmonious radiance of Heaven and Earth, sun and moon’s original harmony, shining and secretly operating to form cinnabar. Within the cinnabar, spontaneously arises the Return Elixir. Like human conception of male and female, all arise from the mutual resonance of father and mother’s *yin-yang* essence and *qi*. The Return Elixir resembles males born face-down and females born face-up—not only in birth, but also in death. Simply cast into water: males sink face-down, females float face-up. Heaven ordains their nature; parents do not cause this.

Within the crucible, metal and water resemble male and female in mutual resonance: the male above, the female below, each attaining their desire. The two essences wrestle, forming the Great Dao.

The formula states: The Golden Elixir must obtain its original foundation, nurtured and subdued by its true father and mother. The father is yang *qi*; the father can emit and move to complete it. The mother is earth, yin *qi*; the mother can contain and nurture to give birth. The mother governs the Central Palace. Yellow earth is the earth that fundamentally generates metal. Cinnabar first receives *qi*, relying on earth to form—thus, it is called the root mother of the Yellow Sprout. Completed by yang, born by the mother—hence called Earth Father. The Earth Father is the Water Mother. Five is the mother of the Five Phases, perpetually generating earth. Water, fire, metal, wood, and earth each occupy a direction, moving to their proper positions. Fire overcomes metal; earth overcomes water. Water is the child of cinnabar. Earth is the crucible. Fire moves to form shape, obtaining earth to complete it. Earth can restrain water; original *qi* resonates to form the Dao. Thus, it is said: "Know the white, guard the black."

The world entirely fails to understand that like attracts like, generating, restraining, and overcoming. Water takes earth as its ghost; earth suppresses water from rising—this is the achievement of *wu-ji*, named the Five Tallies Metal Crucible. Among ten thousand, perhaps one knows this.

Earth tally: the essence of fire and wood. Fire can cook and mature the myriad things, nurturing human life. Fire is the essence of *jia*, the original *qi* of yang. Conjoined in harmony, it merges with the essence of sun and moon, returning to oneness without duality. The essence of *jia* is fire; fire’s number is two. Two generates three; the completion number is nine. Nine is the extreme number of yang, the *qi* of fire.

"Jia is called *zeng*; wood is called green, the agent of the myriad things. The east is the Azure Dragon of wood, the parent of wood and fire, the progeny of fire and wood. *Zhen* is the eldest son; one line generates *Kan*, producing the middle son. Two lines generate fire, born in *chen* and *si*; *Si* and *Li* form the middle daughter. Two lines generate yang, lodging in *bing* and *ding*—the position of fire. Wood gestates fire; to restrain fire, one must borrow water. These three are the Dao of true yang, the positions of *jia* and *yi*, called the Celestial Tally, the token of trust. They can release and discharge the myriad things.

The moon is the Yin Tally, capable of nurturing the myriad things. Earth is the Yin Tally, capable of fostering the myriad things. Fire is the Earth Tally, capable of ripening the myriad things. Metal and water, the primordial *qi*, together with the Yin Tally, can nurture the myriad things. The Direct Tally is like a mirror, likened to the sixty-four hexagrams of the sun and moon, where the six lines release and discharge, and the Celestial Tally completes the Metal Crucible. Ingesting it leads to transcendence—this is the virtue of *Ziming*.

The formula states: Use fire gently, without losing the seasonal nodes; the myriad things arise naturally—this is the meaning of the *River Chariot*. The efficacy lies in the fire timing; failure lies in withdrawal and addition.

One says: The *River Chariot* is the true position of the north, like a chariot’s carrying function.
Another says: *Zi* is metal, *he* is water, *che* is fire—hence *Ziheche* (River Chariot).

**Diagram of Earth Tally Direct Hexagrams and Seasonal Nodes for Advancement and Retreat**
The formula states: Originally employing the four hexagrams, using the four seasonal Direct Tallies in rotation, like a chariot hub’s turning—yin and yang complete their numbers, and creation carries and conveys the myriad things. Thus, it lies in the pitch-pipes and monthly nodes, with the five and six warp and weft serving the sun’s agent. This is recorded in the *Cantong Qi* and will not be repeated here. The advancing and retreating line images are all within the Direct Tally, from one to nine—*Jinhu* (Metal Tiger) spits essence. The formula for the Direct Tally is not detailed here.

The formula states: Entrusting the yin-yang line images, the sixty-four hexagrams establish the analogy. Simply begin with the use of fire at the start, which is the eleventh month, applying the yang seasonal nodes. From the eleventh month’s *Fu* hexagram to the fourth month’s pure *Qian*, the six positions reach extreme yang. From the fifth month’s *Gou* hexagram to the tenth month’s pure *Kun*, the six positions reach extreme yin. This completes one full cycle.

The formula states: In the fifteen days before the full moon, the white moon governs fire and wood, their numbers being seven and eight. *Zhen* presides over spring; wood generates three, the completion number eight. *Li* presides over summer; fire generates two, the completion number seven. Seven and eight make fifteen.

The formula states: In the fifteen days after the full moon, the black moon governs metal and water, their numbers being nine and six. *Dui* presides over autumn; metal generates four, the completion number nine. *Kan* presides over winter; water generates one, the completion number six. Nine and six make fifteen.

The formula states: The foundation of the Five Phases: one is the north’s *ren* and *gui* water; two is the south’s *bing* and *ding* fire; three is the east’s *jia* and *yi* wood; four is the west’s *geng* and *xin* metal; five is the center’s *wu* and *ji* earth. The father is young, and the son is old. The father is *heavenly lead*; heavenly lead is cinnabar. The son, born from the father, is *black lead*—thus, the father is young, and the son is old. The son’s number is indefinite; the father’s number is twenty-five. Water, fire, metal, wood, and earth—the Five Phases shift and change. Five days make one node; five times five is twenty-five—thus, the father is twenty-five. The son’s years of ceaseless movement make the father young and the son old. The world does not know that the myriad things are generated and completed by the Five Phases—these are the parents.

**Fire-Use Formula**
The formula states: The six lines of the Direct Tally move the hexagram nodes; the fire’s weight and measure begin from pure *Kun* and end at *Kun*, cycling without cease.

The formula states: Change the crucible each month; stop at nine crucibles. The tenth crucible may be used at will for rest or activity—whether using the crucible or not, both yield wondrous transformations, for this is the primordial *qi* of generative metal. Thus, it is called the *earth cauldron* or *mother*. The mother is the Metal Crucible.

The formula states: In the operation of metal and water, following the hexagram nodes for fifteen days, the metal nature is extinguished; in thirty days, the elixir is completed. By the tenth month, the original earth is no longer used as the crucible—mother and child part ways in the womb. The *nine revolutions* are the nine crucibles. The *tally* is the father’s function; the *crucible* is the mother’s function. It is likened to a human, who after receiving *qi*, is born in 270 days. The ninth month is when yin and yang are both abundant; the tenth month, when earth flourishes, mother and child separate—hence the name *womb-exiting returning elixir*. It is like a human, whose four *qi* are complete at birth. Just as a child is nurtured for three years until the primordial *qi* is full, the Golden Elixir is completed—this is called *Yellow Lift*. Transforming and returning to the north, the black color becomes translucent—only then is it named the *Great Returning Elixir*. The world does not know this.

The child is the medicine; the mother is the crucible. *Qi* resonates to generate and produce, restrain and subdue, alternately flourishing and declining. Ascending and descending within the crucible, flying and hiding above and below, yin and yang receive each other, intermingling and devouring. The four substances press upon one another; ruler and minister combine. Earth’s nature generates; metal’s nature dies. The four substances are yang within yin and yin within yang. Yet earth is the pivot; the Direct Tally moves—thus, the four substances each reside in their quadrant. When the four natures are extinguished, they return to oneness and revert to the origin—hence the name *Golden Elixir*.

The formula states: Guard and operate for one year, ingest one *liang*—no illness will arise. Guard and operate for two years, complete the White Way—ingest half a *liang*. Guard and operate for three years, the Great Primordial *Qi* is full, complete the Red Way—ingest one *fen*, abide in the world, and attain longevity. A *daogui* (knife-tip) controls mercury to complete the Red Way. Guard and operate for five years, ingest seven grains the size of sesame seeds—attain longevity. A *daogui* transmutes iron and mercury, one *jin* to complete the Red Way. After nine full years of guarding and operating, ingest three grains—the Three Corpses and Nine Worms all depart, and one attains ageless longevity."

chunks.original_text: 五金八石瓦砾，并成至宝。 诀曰：用火所指喻爻象，手镜记火斤两，同用之。 假令十一月建子，一阳爻动，火生二，成数七，运动般载如车轮，一月进一爻，至五月一阴生，一月退一爻，至十月归於土，终而复始。 金砂是日月运动，自然成丹。 因燧人解火，后圣用之成丹。 周天大造化，志在更漏分明，用火不失斤两，节候有准，渐渐如蒸物，年月满足，自然成功。 急则飞走，缓则不伏。 但依直符爻象，则金水自伏矣。 六月阳绝，终於巳。 十二月阴绝，终於亥。 诀曰：丹砂者，阳黑流珠之精，是立乾坤，运水火，应天符，合三才。 金为月精，以处阳位。 汞合离黑，以应六爻。 天地之灵，日月之精，否极泰来，阴尽阳生。 故云：丹砂木精，得金乃并。 是三一之道。 三者火，一者药，名日守一。 又曰：砂是药，金是鼎。 故云：三道由一并根蒂，大道至理门无二。 其砂性温和，无毒，味辛，元黑通灵，万炼而不枯，名曰黑铅。 铅者，砂中自生液，仰月抽出之液，黑。 入仰月配合为夫妻，阳魂含阴魄，两姓自和同。 诀曰：然用五行，乾坤艮巽，直符孕育，从建子初一阳生子，子午相应，五六相通，推移刻漏，日月五星，寒暑来往，昼阳夜阴，交会三十日一。 节节相临，阴阳寒暑，调顺潜伏，循环六十四卦，周而复始，水火相伏，更无外物，五金八石，由人造化。 五金者，五行也。 八石者，八卦也。 水得龙而变化，火得人而运动，还丹养育，不越於五八，也。 诀曰：直符初发之时，文不过九，武不过九。 九者，阳之极数。 三三如九，过之极阴生之首。 阴尽阳生，皆顺天道阴阳，而为运动。 若均金水即顺，节候失序，金水乃乖。 运动如垂组抱卵，受黑而生用事。 相生如寒谷变条，发生应期互用，皆立喻也。 诀曰：日之精元黑，本生南方丙丁火，离位，二阳之中一阴生，日魂，阴汞，水也。 受黑足，移位北方壬癸水，坎寄位，二阴之中一阳生，月魄，阳汞，金也。 水即湛然而不动，无为之体。 火即焰动而乃飞，有为之宗。 将无制有，合成其道。 故知金生阴暗处，始初生是子母相生应也。 诀曰：金入中宫，是名太一，孕育含黄，黑混其青，白虎制度，本黑相从，故日参同。 又云：坎离数一二，南北独为经。 一者水，二者火，万物因水而生，因火而成，火金相伐，水土相克而成丹。 诀曰：直符初发在子，从震而生。 四月火旺，极阳合退。 又从巽而生二木渐顺。 汞初伏虽乾，未是大丹。 守三节名曰丹砂，五节名日金砂。 一年名倒长砂，亦名小还。 二年名魂砂，亦名中还。 三年名金液大丹，人得饵之，乃为上仙。 诀曰：金丹不悟玄理，盖不知丹砂，是铅造化根本。 迷迷相指，误用凡水银、凡铅、凡银，不知凡铅是世银之母。 雄是药之子，砂乃铅之母，黄是土，土乃砂之父祖。 不知错用水银凡铅金银，以为鼎器，为子母。 或炼铅，取其杂石为药。 自古至今，未见得之者，为不知道之本根。 夫神仙之道，道在目前。 砂者木精，得土而生，得土而灭，不离於五行互用，更为父母，相生相灭而成形也。 诀曰：黑能存生，内丹固形，外丹长生，莫过於内外二丹也。 日月之精华，精华者丹砂，元和之黑，乃性命之根基。

The formula states: Use fire as indicated by the moving lines of the hexagrams; record the weight of fire with a hand-mirror, and employ them together. For example, in the eleventh month, when *Jianzi* begins, one yang line stirs—fire begins at two, completing the number seven. The movement and rotation are like a wheel: each month advances one line, until the fifth month when one yin line arises; each month then retreats one line, returning to earth by the tenth month. This cycle repeats endlessly. Cinnabar and gold move like the sun and moon, naturally forming the elixir. Since Suiren mastered fire, later sages used it to refine the elixir. The great creation of the celestial revolution depends on the clarity of the water clock; the fire must not lose its weight, and the seasonal nodes must be precise. Gradually, like steaming food, when the years and months are fulfilled, success comes naturally. If too hasty, the essence will fly away; if too slow, it will not be subdued. Simply follow the moving lines of the hexagrams, and the gold and water will naturally submit.

In the sixth month, yang expires, ending at *si*. In the twelfth month, yin expires, ending at *hai*.

The formula states: Cinnabar is the essence of the yang-black flowing pearl, establishing heaven and earth, circulating water and fire, responding to the celestial tally, and uniting the Three Powers. Gold is the essence of the moon, residing in the yang position. Mercury unites with the *li* hexagram, corresponding to the six lines. The spirit of heaven and earth, the essence of the sun and moon—when negativity reaches its limit, positivity arises. Thus it is said: Cinnabar is the essence of wood, which, when combined with metal, merges as one. This is the Way of the Three-in-One. Three is fire, one is the medicine—this is called "guarding the One." It is also said: Cinnabar is the medicine, gold is the crucible. Hence it is said: The Three Ways originate from one root; the great Dao’s ultimate principle has no duality. Cinnabar is warm and harmonious, non-toxic, pungent in taste, and its primordial blackness connects with the numinous. Though refined ten thousand times, it does not wither—it is called "black lead." Lead is the liquid born within cinnabar, the liquid drawn out by the upturned moon, black in color. When it enters the upturned moon and unites as husband and wife, the yang soul embraces the yin spirit, and the two natures naturally harmonize.

The formula states: Thus, employ the Five Phases—*Qian*, *Kun*, *Gen*, and *Xun*—with the moving tally nurturing and transforming. From *Jianzi*, when the first yang arises at *zi*, *zi* and *wu* correspond, five and six communicate. The water clock shifts, the sun, moon, and five stars move, cold and heat alternate, day as yang and night as yin—every thirty days they conjoin. Each node arrives in sequence; yin and yang, cold and heat, adjust and submit, circulating through the sixty-four hexagrams in endless repetition. Water and fire subdue each other, with nothing external; the five metals and eight minerals are transformed by human effort. The five metals are the Five Phases; the eight minerals are the Eight Trigrams. Water, when met with the dragon, transforms; fire, when met with man, moves. The cyclically transformed elixir is nurtured without exceeding the five and eight.

The formula states: When the moving tally first stirs, civil fire does not exceed nine, and martial fire does not exceed nine. Nine is the extreme number of yang. Three times three is nine; beyond this, the beginning of extreme yin arises. When yin is exhausted, yang is born—all follow the Dao of heaven’s yin and yang in movement. If gold and water are balanced and the seasonal nodes are in order, gold and water harmonize. If the nodes are disordered, gold and water become discordant. The movement is like a silkworm spinning its cocoon or a bird brooding its egg—receiving the blackness to activate its function. Their generation is like the transformation of a cold valley into sprouting branches, occurring at the appointed time and interacting—all are established as metaphors.

The formula states: The essence of the sun is primordial blackness, originally born in the southern *bing ding* fire, the *li* position, where one yin arises amid two yangs—this is the sun’s soul, yin mercury, water. When its blackness is full, it shifts to the northern *ren gui* water, the *kan* position, where one yang arises amid two yins—this is the moon’s spirit, yang mercury, metal. Water is still and unmoving, the substance of non-action. Fire flickers and flies, the origin of action. Uniting the formless with the formed completes the Way. Thus, it is known that metal is born in dark places, initially responding as mother and child.

The formula states: When gold enters the central palace, it is called the Great One, nurturing and containing the yellow, with blackness mixing with the blue. The White Tiger’s system follows the original blackness—hence the term *Cantong*. It is also said: *Kan* and *li* are numbered one and two, uniquely forming the warp of south and north. One is water, two is fire; all things are born through water and completed through fire. Fire and metal contend, water and earth overcome each other to form the elixir.

The formula states: When the moving tally first stirs at *zi*, it arises from *zhen*. In the fourth month, fire flourishes, and extreme yang retreats. Then, from *xun*, two woods gradually align. Though mercury is initially subdued in *qian*, it is not yet the great elixir. Guarding three nodes is called "cinnabar"; five nodes is called "gold sand." One year is called "inverted long sand," also named "lesser return." Two years is called "soul sand," also named "middle return." Three years is called "golden liquid great elixir"—one who ingests it becomes an upper immortal.

The formula states: Those who fail to comprehend the profound principle of the golden elixir do not understand that cinnabar is the root of lead’s transformation. Misled by confusion, they mistakenly use common mercury, common lead, or common silver, unaware that common lead is the mother of worldly silver. Mercury is the child of the medicine, cinnabar is the mother of lead, and yellow is earth—earth is the father and ancestor of cinnabar. Unaware, they err in using common mercury, lead, or silver as crucibles or as mother and child. Some refine lead, extracting its mixed stones as medicine. From ancient times to the present, none have succeeded because they do not know the root of the Dao. The Way of immortals lies before one’s eyes. Cinnabar is the essence of wood, born through earth and extinguished through earth, never departing from the Five Phases’ mutual interaction. They become father and mother, generating and extinguishing to form shape.

The formula states: Blackness can preserve life; the inner elixir secures form, and the outer elixir grants longevity—nothing surpasses these two elixirs, inner and outer. The essence of the sun and moon is cinnabar, the primordial harmony of blackness—the root of nature and life.

The True Oral Instructions state:
Fear only that the lead be not true—
When the elixir is formed, the medicine will be numinous of itself.
Fear only that the mercury be not upright—
When the elixir is formed, the medicine will be sacred of itself.

Never of the four yellows and eight minerals.
Those who speak of the four yellows and eight minerals are in error.

Is perfected through the Four Images—
This is the primordial qi of yin and yang,
The Dao of spontaneous resonance.

It is like a human receiving qi to form the embryo:
Originally endowed with the two qi, red and white—
The man’s essence is white, the woman’s blood is red.
When the two qi intermingle and conjoin,
After ten months the gestation is complete,
And the form and features are fully manifest.
If the received qi is sufficient,
The person will be intelligent and robust.
If the received qi is insufficient,
The person will be dull-witted and weak.
All is of a kind.

This is a discourse of utmost truth—
Let the student ponder it deeply.

The Dragon is mercury, wood, and fire.
The Tiger is lead, silver, Metal’s Elder, and water.
Metal engenders water, water engenders wood,

The Dao abides therein.

It is called the River Chariot.
The worldly, deluded by this,
Exhaust their fortunes and ruin their families.
The perfected, awakened to this,
Ascend upon clouds and tread upon rosy mists.

chunks.original_text: 道之不远，目前可见。 伯阳演《易》而作《参同契》，明阴阳离坎五行之妙用。 事明而隐，学者难明。 虽知铅汞药物，火候精微，鼎炉法象，必究己心。 心者，丹之元也。 若心不契道，虽遇至人得诀，亦恐天理神明不佑，返生魔障，故言难得者人之心也。 心若合道，修之必成。 是知诚心恪志之士少也，非仙圣秘传，盖不得其人也。 陶植三篇，隐而难悟。 《金碧》、《参同》，无师岂明。 余撰《心鉴》，鉴者明也。 明照于心，常握于手，释《参同》之易象，分药数之斤两，了而会之为鉴也。 亦不敢广述多词，又恐招难究之虑。 凡古仙玄旨，本一阴一阳谓之道，阴阳不测之谓神。 神化者，化成万物也。 故《参同》云：植禾当以谷，覆鸡用其子。 类同者相从，事乖不成宝。 陶真人云：砂产於汞，金生於铅，此即真理。 同类不相杂，汞与水银别，迷人用之拙。 铅若是真，不失家臣。 汞生水银死，铅困黄芽真，此乃真说也。 古仙惟言铅汞，不说四黄八石。 学者可为明鉴，所以再三委祝，犹虑后学之人，迷迷相俟。 所名还丹者，还其元丹之色，故曰还丹。 但伏火候，不失其本体之元，号曰还丹。 所言九转者，乃九九易其铅之元气，铅非九炼而成也。 凡灵丹至药，全是阴阳化黑而成，非用他药，杂入于中，纯用方真。 须得真铅之精黑。 若不认真铅，永无成理。 且真铅不变色，真汞有神力。 古仙之言，不可不明也。 黑铅入火，悉为灰烬。 盖为其问真物被销化去矣，为失其元黑。 若将此废残之物，合汞修之，焉得成至药乎。 此说是荡涤凡蒙，显露真奥。 有道眼者，闻余此说，可为醉得冻浆，昏逢朗月，精穷圣典，毋惑灵文，可与神仙共倡，岂不至神仙之境也。 愚者闻之，狐疑不信，故不合与之言也。 仙经云：还丹之妙，在乎三一。 龙虎之英，天地之精。 不用别药，惟用五行。 此至人之言也。 后人得者，不亏古贤之言，不达古贤之法象。 法象者，是天地之本，本立而道生，天地与人为三才，可陕总持造化，运动阴阳，在乎三要，事可忘乎。 失之毫厘，天地悬隔，言何容易哉。 指真诀云：丹砂，太阳之精，本受南方之正黑，得阴阳水火制度，乃居青帝之首，为汞之名，是生于火，自含德而至灵。 铅者，北方黑水之精，化归西方庚辛之金，是以金生水，水生木，二物自相匹配，若非至灵至圣，何以为之神丹乎。 世俗凡庸，岂信此至真之道。 余尝悯之，自古真人皆修炼此神药饵之，故得形神俱妙，与道合真，岂有不信者哉，多指秦皇、汉武为喻。 然大丹之灵，不救自刑之祸。 昔刘玄穆事魏先生，看炉一年，妄情有疑，遂自退而不遇，以致夭丧。 余景休即勤心精德，奉师不息，乃得神丹，饵之而仙，今在太白山仙洞，一千余载，常游人市。 二子者疑与不疑耳，咫尺万里，得与不得，泥途云霄。 且五谷尚能养人之命，况神药之灵乎。 自是世人福薄绿浅，故所不信不遇不修，乃虚生浪死，沉沦多劫。 世人惟贪荣显利禄，沉迷酒色，恩爱牵缠，形枯神丧，犹尚不知，日夜忧思，何有厌足，贵贱富贫，悉皆如此。 见说修真而生谤毁，又何得神仙之道－哉。 不欲广陈。 近代谢冲玄、苏耽二子，并饵金丹而仙，世皆知之。

The Dao is not far—it may be seen before one’s eyes.
Bo Yang expounded the *Yi* and composed the *Cantong Qi*,
Illuminating the wondrous workings of yin-yang, li-k’an, and the Five Phases.
Though its matters are plain, they remain hidden;
Scholars find them hard to grasp.
Even those who know of lead and mercury, medicinal substances,
The subtleties of fire-times, the crucible and furnace, and their symbolic forms,
Must delve into their own minds.
The mind is the origin of the elixir.
If the mind does not accord with the Dao,
Even should one encounter a perfected master and receive the oral transmission,
He may yet fear that Heaven’s principle and the numinous spirits will not protect him,
And instead invite demonic obstructions.
Thus it is said: what is hardest to attain is the human mind.
If the mind harmonizes with the Dao, cultivation will surely succeed.
Few are those of sincere heart and reverent resolve—
It is not that the immortals and sages keep secrets,
But that they do not find the right person.
The three chapters of Tao Hongjing remain obscure and difficult to fathom.
The *Jinbi* and *Cantong Qi*—without a teacher, how can they be understood?
I have composed the *Xinjian*—*jian* means “to illumine.”
Illumined and reflected in the mind, ever held in hand,
It explains the *Cantong Qi*’s symbolic images,
Differentiates the weights and measures of medicinal substances,
And clarifies them into a mirror.
Yet I dare not expound at length,
Lest I invite the burden of endless scrutiny.

The arcane principles of the ancient immortals all return to this:
One yin and one yang are called the Dao;
That which is unfathomable in yin and yang is called the numinous.
The numinous transforms and gives rise to the myriad things.
Thus the *Cantong Qi* states:
“Plant grain with grain,
Hatch a chicken with its egg.”
Like attracts like;
Deviate, and the treasure will not form.
Master Tao said:
“Cinnabar is born of mercury,
Gold is born of lead”—
This is true principle.
Like does not mix with unlike;
Mercury and quicksilver are distinct—
The deluded use them clumsily.
If lead is genuine,
It will not lose its ministerial essence.
Mercury lives, quicksilver dies;
Lead, when refined, becomes true yellow sprout—
This is the true teaching.
The ancient immortals spoke only of lead and mercury,
Never of the Four Yellows or Eight Stones.
Let scholars take this as a clear mirror.
Thus I reiterate and exhort again and again,
Yet still fear that later learners will remain mired in confusion.
The so-called Returned Elixir
Returns to the original color of the primordial elixir—
Hence it is called the Returned Elixir.
Simply master the fire-times,
And do not lose the original essence of its fundamental body—
This is called the Returned Elixir.
The “nine revolutions” refer to the ninefold transformation of lead’s primordial qi;
Lead is not refined nine times to completion.
All divine elixirs and supreme medicines
Are formed solely through the transformation of yin and yang’s qi,
Without the admixture of other substances—
They are purely and truly constituted.
One must obtain the true essence-qi of genuine lead.
Without recognizing true lead,
There can be no success in principle.
Moreover, true lead does not change color,
And true mercury possesses numinous power.
The words of the ancient immortals must not be left obscure.
When base lead enters the fire,
It is reduced entirely to ashes—
For its true essence has been consumed and lost,
And its primordial qi dissipated.
If one takes this spent and ruined substance
And compounds it with mercury,
How can a supreme medicine be formed?
This teaching sweeps away the dust of the vulgar and ignorant,
Revealing the true mystery.
Those with the eye of Dao
Will hear these words of mine
As one parched receives icy water,
Or one benighted meets the bright moon.
They will penetrate the sacred canon,
No longer bewildered by numinous texts,
And may join the immortals in song—
How could they not attain the realm of the immortals?
The foolish, hearing this,
Will doubt and disbelieve—
It is not fitting to speak of such things with them.

The immortal scriptures say:
“The wonder of the Returned Elixir lies in the Three-in-One.
The essence of Dragon and Tiger is the essence of Heaven and Earth.
No other medicines are used—
Only the Five Phases.”
These are the words of the perfected.
Those who attain this afterward
Do not betray the words of the ancient worthies,
Nor fail to grasp their symbolic forms.
The symbolic forms are the root of Heaven and Earth;
When the root is established, the Dao arises.
Heaven, Earth, and Humanity are the Three Powers—
How can one narrowly cling to the workings of creation,
The movement of yin and yang,
Without attending to the Three Essentials?
Lose it by a hair’s breadth,
And Heaven and Earth become as distant as sky and abyss—
How can such words be spoken lightly?
The true oral transmission states:
“Cinnabar is the essence of the Great Yang,
Originally receiving the true qi of the South,
Governed by the regulations of yin-yang water and fire.
It resides at the head of the Azure Emperor,
And is called mercury—
Born of fire,
It inherently possesses virtue and reaches the numinous.
Lead is the essence of the Black Water of the North,
Transformed and returning to the Metal of the West’s geng and xin.
Thus Metal engenders Water, Water engenders Wood—
These two substances naturally match each other.
Were they not supremely numinous and sagely,
How could they form the divine elixir?”
The vulgar and common of the world
How could they believe in this most true Dao?
I have long pitied them.
Since ancient times, all true persons have refined and ingested this divine medicine,
Thus attaining wondrous union of form and spirit,
And merging with the Dao in truth.
How could there be any who do not believe?
Many cite the First Emperor of Qin and Emperor Wu of Han as examples.
Yet the numinous power of the Great Elixir
Cannot save one from the calamity of self-inflicted harm.
Formerly, Liu Xuanyu served Master Wei,
Tending the furnace for a year,
But his idle thoughts gave rise to doubt,
And he withdrew without attaining the Way,
Meeting an early death.
Yu Jingxiu, by contrast,
Diligently cultivated his mind and perfected his virtue,
Serving his teacher without cease,
And obtained the divine elixir.
After ingesting it, he became an immortal,
And now dwells in the immortal cave of Mount Taibai,
Having passed over a thousand years,
Yet still wanders the markets of men.
These two—one doubted, one did not—
The difference between them is as vast as a foot and a thousand miles,
Between attainment and non-attainment,
Between muddy paths and cloudy skies.
Even the Five Grains can sustain human life—
How much more the numinous power of the divine medicine?
Yet people of the world are shallow in blessing and karma,
Thus they do not believe, do not encounter, do not cultivate,
Living in vain and dying in delusion,
Sinking through countless kalpas.
People of the world are only greedy for glory, fame, and profit,
Bewitched by wine and sensuality,
Entangled in love and attachment,
Their forms withered and spirits lost,
Yet still they do not awaken.
Day and night they fret and worry—
When will they ever be satisfied?
Noble and base, rich and poor—
All are the same.
Hearing of the cultivation of truth, they slander and revile it—
How then could they attain the Dao of the immortals?
I do not wish to expound further.

In recent times, Xie Chongxuan and Su Dan—
Both ingested the Golden Elixir and became immortals,
As the world well knows.

chunks.original_text: 况得之士，多混迩人问，和光同尘，人岂识之。 《参同》云：金以砂为主。 禀和於水银。 变化由其真，终始自相因，二物自含孕也。 又云：不用药，用五行。 又云：天生芽，自然体。 又云：白马牙，真丹砂，卯酉二八和两家。 又云：淮南炼秋石，黄帝美金华。 又云：芽不是铅，铅不是芽。 真铅真丹砂，二物玄旨也。 伏炼一家。 巡火近九转，自然成黄芽。 又云：火化白，药化红，灵砂秋石自相同。 又云：孤阴不独化，寡阳不可成。 本来清诤质，自有变通灵。 又云：龙虎相逢遇，何时不相顾。 白液共相吞，相吞为夫妇。 随变成黄芽，逐时依后土。 若了紫河车，自然升天涯。 又云：神丹修得诀，神用便由人。 生煞在我手，参详在伪真。 又云：修丹不得诀，终岁损心神。 莫炼枯铅汞，抛功似土尘。 又云：天地日月中，灵药号金公。 金公不是铅，本向铅裹蒙。 分明向君说，迷者又匆匆。 点汞安铅裹，金华意略同。 此华不是药，徒自枉抛功。 此事神仙说，何曾不大通。 细看《参同契》，仍依五类融。 但觅直铅汞，修之可见功。 又云：铅汞合天地，修作大还丹。 丹成自见宝，非此实为难。 太古真人说，如今达者惶。 方知真切意，须契道将安。 其中有五彩，灵变伏其盘。 十月脱胎去，令人见者欢。 为报荣华子，百年凋与残。 如何空弃世，兀兀道情宽。 细说君犹谤，灵词理更馒。 嗟见南北尘，积年为丘山。 茫茫苦海中，生死成波澜。 自古帝王居，而今何足看。 又云：白液炉中化，黄芽变渐成。 忆初相见日，难觅水银形。 阳极生阴火，火衰阳黑并。 自然变黄芽，服食乃长生。 一个月白液，初凝却如雪。 两个月状似，融苏渐渐结。 三个月半含，药绽垂珠劣。 四个月二物，抱持如点血。 五个月飞腾，恋母声呜咽。 六个月行到，紫宫阳气绝。 七个月乘阴，受黑手足厥。 八个月欲成，脏腑含凝血。 九个月点点，成珠长毛发。 十个月母子，分离欲相别。 此时母困子体全，已见肌容变白雪。 铅脱胞后，铅白如雪。 更看炉中温养之，兼为全体肌容悦，出儿毒黑当依诀。 经云：此药如子在母胎精中，爽朗分肌骨，有次第，莫亏越，但知修得黄芽，成变转之功，无休绝，饵长生，换白发，有白银，济贫乏。 仁者得之终不辍，与道契宿绿深。 传若得人，须在心。

Moreover, those who attain it often mingle among common folk, blending their light with the dust—how could others recognize them?

The *Cantong Qi* states:
*"Gold takes cinnabar as its master,
Receiving harmony from mercury.
Transformation arises from its truth,
Beginning and end naturally follow,
The two substances conceiving of themselves."*

It further says:
*"Do not use mere herbs—employ the Five Phases."*
And:
*"Heaven engenders the sprout,
Its body naturally formed."*
And:
*"White Horse’s Teeth, true cinnabar,
Mao and You, the two eights, harmonize the two families."*
And:
*"Huainan refines autumn stone,
The Yellow Emperor cherishes golden blossoms."*
And:
*"The sprout is not lead,
Lead is not the sprout.
True lead, true cinnabar—
These two hold the profound essence.
Refined as one household,
Circulating fire nears the ninth revolution,
Naturally forming the yellow sprout."*

It also says:
*"Fire transforms to white,
The medicine turns to red,
Divine cinnabar and autumn stone unite of themselves."*
And:
*"Solitary yin cannot transform alone,
Lone yang cannot achieve completion.
Their original pure and limpid essence
Possesses a numinous power of change."*
And:
*"Dragon and tiger meet—
When do they not attend each other?
White liquid and the other swallow one another,
Swallowing as husband and wife.
Following change, they form the yellow sprout,
Proceeding in time to rely on the earth."*
And:
*"If you comprehend the Purple River Chariot,
You will naturally ascend to the edge of heaven."*
And:
*"Once the divine elixir’s method is mastered,
Its spiritual use lies in your hands.
Life and death rest in my grasp—
Discernment lies in distinguishing false from true."*
And:
*"Without the elixir’s method,
Years of effort waste the heart and spirit.
Do not refine withered lead and mercury,
Lest your work scatter like dust."*

It further states:
*"Within heaven, earth, sun, and moon,
The numinous medicine is called Metal Lord.
The Metal Lord is not lead—
It is originally concealed within lead.
I speak plainly to you,
Yet the deluded rush past in haste.
Mercury is fixed within lead,
The golden blossom’s intent is roughly the same.
This blossom is no mere herb—
To refine it is to waste effort in vain."*
And:
*"This matter is spoken by immortals—
How could it not be profoundly clear?
Study the *Cantong Qi* closely,
And still rely on the Five Categories’ fusion.
Seek only true lead and mercury—
Cultivate them, and you will see results."*

It also says:
*"Lead and mercury unite heaven and earth,
Refined to make the Great Return Elixir.
When the elixir is complete, treasures appear of themselves—
Without this, success is truly difficult.
The Perfected of Great Antiquity spoke thus,
Yet even the wise of today are perplexed.
Only when you grasp the true and essential meaning
Can you align with the Dao and find peace.
Within it lies fivefold radiance,
Spiritual transformations subduing its vessel.
After ten months, the embryo is shed—
Those who witness it rejoice.
I report to the seekers of glory:
A hundred years wither and decay.
Why idly abandon the world,
Dull and content in the Dao’s embrace?
Though I explain in detail, you still slander,
The numinous words’ principle grows ever more obscure.
Alas! Behold the dust of north and south,
Piled over years into mountains and hills.
Amidst the boundless bitter sea,
Birth and death churn like waves.
Since ancient times, even emperors dwelled here—
What is there to admire now?"*

It further says:
*"The white liquid transforms within the furnace,
The yellow sprout gradually forms.
Recall the first day they met—
Mercury’s form was hard to find.
When yang reaches its extreme, yin fire arises,
When fire declines, yang and black merge.
Naturally, the yellow sprout changes—
Ingest it, and you attain long life.
In one month, the white liquid
First congeals, like snow.
In two months, it resembles
Softened wax, slowly solidifying.
In three months, half-contained,
The medicine splits, dangling like flawed pearls.
In four months, the two substances
Embrace, like drops of blood.
In five months, it soars,
Yearning for its mother with mournful cries.
In six months, it arrives—
The yang qi of the Purple Palace is cut off.
In seven months, riding yin,
It receives blackness, hands and feet growing numb.
In eight months, nearing completion,
The viscera hold congealed blood.
In nine months, drop by drop,
Pearls form, hair grows long.
In ten months, mother and child
Part, about to separate.
At this time, the mother is exhausted, the child’s body whole—
Already, the flesh and complexion turn white as snow.
After the lead sheds its womb,
The lead is white as snow.
Observe its gentle nurturing in the furnace,
And the child’s entire body becomes radiant.
Expel the child’s black poison as the method instructs."*

The Classic says:
*"This medicine is like a child in the mother’s womb,
Bright and clear, distinguishing flesh and bone,
Following a sequence—do not transgress it.
Simply know how to cultivate the yellow sprout,
Achieving the power of transformation,
Without cessation.
Ingest it to attain long life,
Turn white hair black,
Possess silver’s whiteness,
Relieve poverty and want.
The benevolent who obtain it never cease—
Their affinity with the Dao runs deep.
If you transmit it to the right person,
It must reside in the heart."*

chunks.original_text: 非道者罪愆深，得亦为灾祸自侵。 关造化不容易，不可取次轻相示。 不见古人有诚词，妄有传之殃祖补。 君须信，不在疑，贤者通明须得之。 今日祝君千万意，历历设盟当戒之。 阳起复阴起，娠炉寄中央戊己土鼎。 上下互相，辏保守固之，勿令走消息。 不失看节候。 有龙有虎相奔骤，婴儿寂寂颜如幼。 犹母养之，母体瘦子成，母困长相救。 阳极乾，阴极坤，四象五行易之门，六十四卦遁中尊，龙虎相啖复相吞，立其定位此中存。 水火为媒拘我魂，阴阳育我明晨昏。 八节运移寒与温，看看渐变黄芽根。 日月相催感母恩，因之结实立真门。 千秋万岁生子孙，审藏神法慎勿言。 此道玄微不可论，世人笑道浑浊昏。 莫将神药示凡人，见之生谤言语喧。 君切记，勿妄示，慎而藏之置金柜。 长生之道传贤哲，自有天官录名字。 饵还丹应候歌 夫拟服还丹兮，澡心炼黑。 清斋省躬兮，存真息念。 司命灵兮，降鉴斜录。 司药童子兮，察人虔恭。 不可轻慢兮，毋生懈怠。 宜须审细兮，方其灵感。 或喉中温痒兮，热而欲闷绝。 或口中腥臭兮，如腐肉之在中。 是心府开兮，逐滞邪之黑。 都被赴出兮，有此神功。 热炙甘草兮，含津咽五日。 五神自爽兮，真黑皆和融。 或腰脐下兮，停滞恶物。 或腹呜吼兮，泻下诸虫。 或出血块兮，如紫葵汁。 又如蚌蟆兮，或涎或脓。 宿食在胃兮，时时郁闷。 食引欲吐兮，心闷冲冲。 呕吐宿水兮，饮食不进。 并是宿疾兮，被神药而攻。 待至苦肌兮，多煎甘草饮。 至半碗兮，汤味须浓。 四肢拘急兮，或多燥闷。 欲发狂乱兮，或致昏蒙。 忽然怕怖兮，精神恍惚。 或心不安兮，情意憧憧。 或梦坠堕兮，高山大石。 或梦军阵兮，人马相逢。 或梦恶人兮，名状论诉。 或梦逢见兮，虎豹蛇虫。 或梦亲爱兮，死亡离别。 或梦恶人兮，擒捉追踪。 或梦哭泣兮，冤家伤害。 并是尸鬼兮，欲离身中。 觉有此候兮，切须消息。 宜节喜怒兮，勿恣心胸。 三尸若去兮，少人我思虑。 举动纯和兮，体貌温恭。 心意安稳兮，世情疏薄。 嗜欲自断兮，德合上穹。 或喉额问兮，微有少痛。 咽物闷涩兮，热痒重重。 或小便兮，青黄紫汁。 或痢泄兮，脓血死虫。 并是远年兮，风劳之气。 百疾消除兮，方见神功。 或生疮痉兮，齿根出血。 此是攻去兮，皮骨之风。 觉四肢劳困兮，是药力之所及。 四肢滑腻兮，乃药气之内融。 但有宿疾兮，并皆发散。 积聚毒黑兮，痕瘢黑红。 此乃毒黑兮，分明散去。 黑蒸肌骨兮，目明耳聪。 目开耳动兮，血腥在口。 为换毂齿兮，药力方隆。 毛发生长兮，体轻身健。 肌骨清和兮，改变凡容。 服食一年兮，万黑齐旺。 服经二年兮，血脉大通。 服经三载兮，筋骨坚壮。 髓实朱筋兮，颜似婴童。 大小二便兮，都无秽气。 手足轻举兮，肠化如筋。 寒暑不侵兮，兵刃不害。 入水不溺兮，入火如空。 齿落重生兮，发白再黑。 身似欲飞兮，行步如风。 不饥不渴兮，五谷自断。 不寒不暑兮，透出凡笼。 千邪百怪兮，皆不敢近。 山川鬼神兮，朝礼敬恭。 五十以下兮，服经一岁。 二十七八兮，稚子春容。 五十以上兮，服经二载。 如六十七八兮，朱颜再红。 出九阴之表兮，为纯阳之质。 长生久视兮，天地齐同。 若欲升举兮，一年断谷。

Those who lack the Dao incur profound transgressions;
Even if obtained, calamity and misfortune will assail them.
The workings of creation are not easily grasped—
Do not casually reveal them to others.
Have you not seen the solemn oaths of the ancients?
To recklessly transmit this invites ancestral retribution.
You must believe without doubt,
For only the wise and enlightened may receive it.
Today, I pledge to you with utmost sincerity—
Let every vow be solemnly observed.

When yang arises, yin follows;
The embryo’s furnace rests in the central earth of wu-ji’s crucible.
Above and below, they mutually converge and guard,
Firmly preserving the subtle balance—
Never let the breath of life escape.
Attend closely to the seasons and signs.
Dragon and tiger race and chase,
While the infant lies serene, its countenance youthful.
As the mother nurtures, her body grows lean while the child matures;
When the mother falters, the child sustains her.

Yang culminates in qian, yin in kun—
The Four Symbols and Five Phases are the gateway of the *Yi*,
The sixty-four hexagrams hold the honored place within the Recluse.
Dragon and tiger devour and swallow one another,
Yet their fixed positions abide within this.
Water and fire serve as mediators to bind my soul,
Yin and yang nurture me through dawn and dusk.
The eight nodes shift between cold and warmth—
Gradually, the root of the yellow sprout transforms.
Sun and moon urge one another, moved by the mother’s grace,
Thereby forming the fruit and establishing the true gate.
For a thousand autumns and ten thousand years, it begets descendants;
Guard the method of concealing the spirit—speak of it with utmost care.

This Dao is subtle and profound, beyond discourse;
The world scorns it, lost in turbid confusion.
Do not show the divine medicine to the unworthy,
For they will slander it with clamorous words.
Remember this well—do not recklessly reveal it;
Store it securely in a golden casket.
The Way of long life is transmitted to the worthy and wise—
Heaven’s officials will record their names.

**Song of Ingesting the Returned Elixir**

To ingest the returned elixir,
Purify the heart and refine the black.
Observe fasting, examine the self,
Preserve the true and still the thoughts.
The spirit of the Controller of Fate descends to witness and record;
The youthful attendant of the medicine observes one’s reverence.
Do not treat it lightly or grow lax—
Proceed with meticulous care to invoke its numinous response.

At times, the throat may feel warm and itchy,
Hot and on the verge of suffocation.
Or the mouth may taste foul,
As if putrid flesh lies within.
This is the heart’s palace opening,
Expelling stagnant blackness and evil.
All is drawn forth—
Such is the divine efficacy.

Soothe with roasted licorice,
Holding the liquid in the mouth and swallowing for five days.
The five spirits will become clear,
And the true blackness will harmonize and dissolve.

At times, foul matter may lodge below the waist and navel,
Or the abdomen may rumble and roar,
Expelling various worms.
Or blood clots may emerge,
Like purple mallow juice,
Or like toads—
Now phlegm, now pus.
Long-standing food stagnates in the stomach,
Causing frequent oppression.
The urge to vomit arises,
The heart feels stifled and surging.
One may retch up stale water,
Unable to take food or drink.
All these are old ailments—
Assailed by the divine medicine.

When the suffering in the flesh peaks,
Brew a strong decoction of licorice,
Half a bowl in volume,
The broth rich in flavor.
The limbs may grow stiff and tense,
Or one may feel parched and stifled.
The urge to rave and lose control may arise,
Or one may fall into confusion.
Suddenly seized by fear,
The spirit wanders in disarray.
The heart may feel unsettled,
The mind restless and distracted.
One may dream of falling
From lofty mountains and towering rocks,
Or of armies clashing,
Men and horses locked in battle.
Or of encountering evil men,
Engaged in disputes and lawsuits.
Or of meeting
Tigers, leopards, snakes, and insects.
Or of beloved ones
Dying and parting in sorrow.
Or of wicked men
Pursuing and seizing one.
Or of weeping and wailing,
Wronged by enemies.
All these are the corpses and ghosts
Seeking to depart the body.
When such signs appear,
Take heed and adjust accordingly.
Regulate joy and anger,
Do not indulge the heart’s desires.

When the Three Corpses depart,
Fewer thoughts of self and others arise.
Movements become pure and harmonious,
Demeanor gentle and respectful.
The heart finds peace,
Worldly attachments grow thin.
Desires sever themselves,
Virtue aligns with the celestial vault.

At times, the throat or forehead may ache slightly,
Swallowing may feel stifled and rough,
With layer upon layer of heat and itching.
Or the urine may appear
Blue, yellow, or purple.
Or one may suffer from dysentery,
Expelling pus, blood, and dead worms.
All these are the winds and consumptive qi
Of long-standing ailments.
When a hundred illnesses vanish,
The divine efficacy becomes evident.

At times, sores or convulsions may appear,
Or the gums may bleed.
This is the expulsion
Of wind from skin and bone.
When the limbs feel weary and strained,
It is the medicine’s power at work.
When the limbs grow smooth and supple,
It is the medicine’s qi fusing within.

All old ailments will surface,
Accumulations and toxins—black and foul—
Scars and blemishes, black and red.
These are the toxins and blackness
Clearly dispersing.
As the blackness steams through flesh and bone,
The eyes brighten and the ears sharpen.
The eyes open, the ears stir,
A bloody taste lingers in the mouth.
The teeth are renewed,
The medicine’s power now ascendant.
Hair grows long,
The body light and strong.
Flesh and bone become pure and harmonious,
Transforming the mortal countenance.

After one year of ingestion,
A myriad blacknesses flourish.
After two years,
The blood and vessels flow freely.
After three years,
Sinews and bones grow firm and robust.
The marrow fills, the red sinews thrive,
The complexion resembles that of a child.
Both major and minor eliminations
Are free of foul odors.
The hands and feet move lightly,
The intestines transform like sinew.
Unaffected by cold or heat,
Unscathed by blades or weapons.
Entering water, one does not drown;
Entering fire, one is as if in emptiness.
Teeth that fell regrow,
White hair turns black again.
The body seems poised to fly,
Steps swift as the wind.
Neither hunger nor thirst,
The five grains are naturally forsaken.
Neither cold nor heat,
One transcends the mortal cage.
A thousand evils and a hundred perils
Dare not approach.
Mountains and rivers, ghosts and spirits
Pay homage with reverence.

If under fifty,
One year of ingestion suffices.
At twenty-seven or twenty-eight,
One regains the springtime glow of youth.
If over fifty,
Two years of ingestion are needed.
At sixty-seven or sixty-eight,
The rosy complexion returns.
Emerging beyond the nine yin,
One becomes a being of pure yang.
Long life and eternal vision—
One’s years equal those of heaven and earth.
Should one wish to ascend,
A year of grain abstention will suffice.

chunks.original_text: 服满一剂兮，便获飞空。 未欲上升兮，且作地仙。 而隐清斋一日兮，饵剂之功。 可以畜妻子兮，住世居官。 任意无所禁兮，和光同尘。 后欲上升兮，清斋更服半剂。 驾云乘鹤兮，白日登空。 欲点五金兮，并化为宝。 鸡餐成凤兮，犬饵成龙。 指真秘诀 阴真君云：金丹之道百数，其要在神水华池，河车伏汞。 达者得之，飞丹炼石，千百余方，大丹之要，不出乎《金碧》、《参同》二书。 但能精修铅汞，伏火成丹，便是大还，至妙无可加矣。 ．只要认得真铅汞，即伏得丹砂也。 若非真种，类万无可成。 学者必须广寻师指，不耻下问，方希觊。 如或心高气强，自执一方，至老无成。 古歌云：白汞生丹砂，黑铅化黄芽。 其终数九九，变化在三华。 修到紫阳宫，黄金无处夸。 但得金公合，修成金液砂。 如未至此之至妙，但得伏火成丹，便是长生至药。 又云：然自用铅，不得令铅居汞内，须礼尽其铅。 去尽祖然后可修事服食，此是妙用，为黄芽之道也。 且草药黄精，尚能延驻年命，野葛多食，必致杀人。 岂不目击，何不信有长生之道耶，只是世人福绿浅薄也。 经云：龙虎相投，还丹可求。 神仙之道，不示凡流。 乃知大丹之妙，不离于真铅真汞，神符白雪也。 还丹肘徒诀卷中竟 还丹肘后诀卷下 玄迪秘奥 凡炼金液神丹者，须要洞晓阴阳，深达造化，明五行相克之幽微，识金水相生之妙理，采先天之一，用作丹基，会乾坤为鼎器，以坎离为药材。 夫坎离者J 日月也。 日象者，阳含阴也。 日中有乌，卦主於离，外阳而内阴也。 砂中有木之一，青龙之位也。 五行颠倒术，龙从火里出，父之精也。 月象者，阴含阳也。 月中有兔，卦主．於坎，外阴而内阳也。 铅中有金之一，白虎之位也。 五行不顺行，虎向水中生，母之血也。 父精是真汞，母血是真铅，真铅生在黑铅中，真汞产於朱砂内，二物为真阴真阳也。 真阴乃离中汞，真阳乃坎中铅。 故云：日精若与月华合，自有真铅出世来。 若得真铅，是为丹之祖也。 真铅便是丹之祖，何必区区炼铅母。 炼铅非炼石中铅，自有天铅波里取。 铅为芽母，芽为铅子。 若得金花，舍铅不使。 转转自相因，一子别一子。 若能转制汞，万变与千通，世问无比类。 学人多以五金八石，草木灰霜，皆为俟用也。 夫五金八石，乃天地之后生，有质之物，不与水银同体。 夫水银者，天元之秀，日月之精华，不与世之五金八石，草木灰霜同体。 故云：有质不堪为伴倡，无质生质是还丹。 又云； 水银一味仙家禄，自古流传伏火难。 若遇河车成紫粉，紫粉一时化金丹。 夫金丹者，央炼鼎器，非五金八石磁土为之。 夫鼎者，乃以鼎其鼎。 夫药者，乃以药其药。 鼎药者，本一也。 故云：鼎鼎元无鼎，药药元无药。 黄芽不是铅，不离铅中作。 又用铅不得用凡铅，用了真铅也弃捐。 若舍其铅，如弃父母，而求子也。 若用其铅，离铅万里。 不用其铅，从何而起。 既得金华入腹中，还是舍铅终不使。 红铅黑铅大丹头，将红入黑是真修。 红取精兮黑取髓，便是还丹真妙理。 红铅离卦，黑铅坎卦，若把坎离二卦撮於鼎中，采一日之火候，夺造化之千年，都来片饷工夫，永得真铅至宝。 水银死者为铅，活者为汞，此自相制伏也。
